info.title: Bitly
info.description: Shorten, Share and Track your links with the Bitly APIs.

get.summary: Get Shorten
get.description: Given a long URL, returns a bitly short URL.

parameters.name: longUrl
parameters.description: a long URL to be shortened (example: http://betaworks.com/)

parameters.name: domain
parameters.description: (optional) refers to a preferred domain; either bit.ly, j.mp, or bitly.com, for users who do NOT have a custom short domain set up with bitly. This affects the output value of url. The default for this parameter is the short domain selected by each user in his/her bitly account settings. Passing a specific domain via this parameter will override the default settings for users who do NOT have a custom short domain set up with bitly. For users who have implemented a custom short domain, bitly will

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Response format.

get.summary: Get Expand
get.description: Given a bitly URL or hash (or multiple), returns the target (long) URL.

parameters.name: shortUrl
parameters.description: Short URL to be expanded.

parameters.name: hash
parameters.description: Refers to one or more bitly hashes.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Response format.

get.summary: Get Link Lookup
get.description: This is used to query for a bitly link based on a long URL.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: One or more long URLs to lookup.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Response format.

get.summary: Get Info
get.description: This is used to return the page title for a given bitly link.

parameters.name: shortUrl
parameters.description: Short URL to be expanded.

parameters.name: hash
parameters.description: Refers to one or more bitly hashes.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Response format.

get.summary: Get User Info
get.description: Return information about a user.

parameters.name: login
parameters.description: (optional) the bitly login of the user whose info to look up. If not given, the authenticated user will be used.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Response format.

get.summary: Get User Link History
get.description: Returns entries from a user's link history in reverse chronological order.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: (optional) integer in the range 1 to 100 -    default: 50, specifying the max number of results to return.

parameters.name: created_before
parameters.description: (optional) timestamp as an integer unix epoch.

parameters.name: created_after
parameters.description: (optional) timestamp as an integer unix epoch.

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: (optional)    the user for whom to retrieve history entries (if different from authenticated user).

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Response format.

get.summary: Get User Popular Links
get.description: Returns the authenticated user's most-clicked bitly links (ordered by number of clicks) in a given time period.

parameters.name: unit
parameters.description: minute, hour, day, week or month

parameters.name: units
parameters.description: an integer representing the time units to query data for. Pass -1 to return all units of time.

parameters.name: timezone
parameters.description: (optional) an integer hour offset from UTC (-14 to 14)

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: (optional) integer in the range 1 to 100 -    default: 50, specifying the max number of results to return.

parameters.name: rollup
parameters.description: (optional) true or false. Return data for multiple units rolled up to a single result instead of a separate value for each period of time.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Response format.

get.summary: Get Link Clicks
get.description: Returns entries from a user's link history in reverse chronological order.

parameters.name: link
parameters.description: a bltly link.

parameters.name: unit
parameters.description: minute, hour, day, week or month

parameters.name: units
parameters.description: an integer representing the time units to query data for. Pass -1 to return all units of time.

parameters.name: timezone
parameters.description: (optional) an integer hour offset from UTC (-14 to 14)

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: (optional) integer in the range 1 to 100 -    default: 50, specifying the max number of results to return.

parameters.name: rollup
parameters.description: (optional) true or false. Return data for multiple units rolled up to a single result instead of a separate value for each period of time.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Response format.

get.summary: Get Link Countries
get.description: Returns metrics about the countries referring click traffic to a single bitly link.

parameters.name: link
parameters.description: a bltly link.

parameters.name: unit
parameters.description: minute, hour, day, week or month

parameters.name: units
parameters.description: an integer representing the time units to query data for. Pass -1 to return all units of time.

parameters.name: timezone
parameters.description: (optional) an integer hour offset from UTC (-14 to 14)

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: (optional) integer in the range 1 to 100 -    default: 50, specifying the max number of results to return.

parameters.name: rollup
parameters.description: (optional) true or false. Return data for multiple units rolled up to a single result instead of a separate value for each period of time.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Response format.

get.summary: Get Link Referrers
get.description: Returns metrics about the pages referring click traffic to a single bitly link.

parameters.name: link
parameters.description: a bltly link.

parameters.name: unit
parameters.description: minute, hour, day, week or month

parameters.name: units
parameters.description: an integer representing the time units to query data for. Pass -1 to return all units of time.

parameters.name: timezone
parameters.description: (optional) an integer hour offset from UTC (-14 to 14)

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: (optional) integer in the range 1 to 100 -    default: 50, specifying the max number of results to return.

parameters.name: rollup
parameters.description: (optional) true or false. Return data for multiple units rolled up to a single result instead of a separate value for each period of time.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Response format.

get.summary: Get Link Shares
get.description: Returns metrics about a shares of a single link.

parameters.name: link
parameters.description: a bltly link.

parameters.name: unit
parameters.description: minute, hour, day, week or month

parameters.name: units
parameters.description: an integer representing the time units to query data for. Pass -1 to return all units of time.

parameters.name: timezone
parameters.description: (optional) an integer hour offset from UTC (-14 to 14)

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: (optional) integer in the range 1 to 100 -    default: 50, specifying the max number of results to return.

parameters.name: rollup
parameters.description: (optional) true or false. Return data for multiple units rolled up to a single result instead of a separate value for each period of time.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Response format.

get.summary: Get Search
get.description: Search links receiving clicks across bitly by content, language, location, and more.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: string to query for.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: (optional) integer in the range 1 to 100 -    default: 50, specifying the max number of results to return.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: (optional) which result to start with (defaults to 0).

parameters.name: cities
parameters.description: (optional) show links active in this city (ordered like country-state-city, e.g. us-il-chicago).

parameters.name: lang
parameters.description: (optional) favor results in this language (two letter ISO code).

parameters.name: domain
parameters.description: (optional) refers to a preferred domain; either bit.ly, j.mp, or bitly.com, for users who do NOT have a custom short domain set up with bitly. This affects the output value of url. The default for this parameter is the short domain selected by each user in his/her bitly account settings. Passing a specific domain via this parameter will override the default settings for users who do NOT have a custom short domain set up with bitly. For users who have implemented a custom short domain, bitly will

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Response format.

get.summary: Get Realtime Bursting Phrases
get.description: Returns phrases that are receiving an uncharacteristically high volume of click traffic, and the individual links (hashes) driving traffic to pages containing these phrases.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Response format.

get.summary: Get Realtime Hot Phrases
get.description: Returns phrases that are receiving a consistently high volume of click traffic, and the individual links (hashes) driving traffic to pages containing these phrases.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Response format.

get.summary: Create a new bundle for the authenticated user.
get.description: Create a new bundle for the authenticated user.

parameters.description: A value true or false designating the privacy setting of the bundle to be created.

parameters.description: The URL corresponding to the bundle to be archived.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: The title of the bundle to be created.

parameters.name: og_image
parameters.description: The URL to the bundle's cover image.

parameters.name: edit
parameters.description:
A field designating which properties (e.g., 'title', 'description') are
to be edited, allowing for these fields to be updated with empty values.

parameters.name: preview
parameters.description:
A true or false value representing whether or not content previews should
be shown for the specified bundle's links.

parameters.name: private
parameters.description: A value true or false designating the privacy setting of the bundle to be created.

get.summary: Change the position of a link in a bitly bundle.
get.description: Change the position of a link in a bitly bundle.

parameters.name: link
parameters.description: a bltly link.

parameters.name: bundle_link
parameters.description: The URL corresponding to the bundle to be archived.

parameters.name: display_order
parameters.description:
The new display_order value to be assigned to the the specified link. (A
value of -1 moves to end, 0 to the front, any other number moves it to
that spot, bumping everythign else down.)

get.description:
Returns the number of clicks on a single bitly link.
Note: historical data is stored hourly beyond the most recent 60 minutes.
If a unit_reference_ts is specified, unit cannot be minute.

parameters.name: link
parameters.description: a bltly link.

parameters.name: unit
parameters.description: minute, hour, day, week or month

parameters.name: units
parameters.description: an integer representing the time units to query data for. Pass -1 to return all units of time.

parameters.name: timezone
parameters.description: (optional) an integer hour offset from UTC (-14 to 14)

parameters.name: rollup
parameters.description: (optional) true or false. Return data for multiple units rolled up to a single result instead of a separate value for each period of time.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: (optional) integer in the range 1 to 100 -    default: 50, specifying the max number of results to return.

parameters.name: unit_reference_ts
parameters.description:
An epoch timestamp, indicating the most recent time for which to pull
metrics, default: now.
The value of unit_reference_ts rounds to the nearest unit.

get.description:
Changes link metadata in a user's history.
Because link metadata is modified asynchronously, it may take a few moments
for changes made via this API method to update.

parameters.name: link
parameters.description: a bltly link.

parameters.name: edit
parameters.description:
A field designating which properties (e.g., 'title', 'description') are
to be edited, allowing for these fields to be updated with empty values.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: The title of the bundle to be created.

parameters.name: note
parameters.description: A description of, or note about, this bitmark.

parameters.name: private
parameters.description: A value true or false designating the privacy setting of the bundle to be created.

parameters.name: user_ts
parameters.description: Timestamp as an integer epoch.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description:
On, off or both whether to include or exclude archived history entries.
(on = return only archived history entries)

bundle_link.description: An echo of the input bundle_link parameter.

view_count.description: The number of times the bundle has been viewed.

login.description: The specified bitly login or the login of the authenticated user.

member_since.description: Unix timestamp for the moment the user signed up.

full_name.description: The user's full name, if set.

display_name.description: The user's display name, if set.

is_enterprise.description: 0 or 1 to indicate if this account is signed up for bitly enterprise.

master_account.description: The login of a master account, if this is associated with an enterprise account.
